attributes.action: being in an accident that wasn't your fault shouldn't make your premiums go up
attributes.additional_details:
I was in two accidents earlier in the year. Neither of which I was found at fault. When I went to renew my motorbike insurance, it was only about £80 cheaper despite having 3 years no claims bonus and also being 22 instead of 21. 
I was declined insurance from a pay as you go insurance company because of my incident history. Checking to see how much my insurance would be from a normal insurance company and 3rd party is £500 more expensive than my bike insurance.
attributes.background: Make it illegal for insurance companies to increase or decline premiums just because some other road user was negligent in their driving.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Ban insurance premium increases after no-fault accidents
